question.title: Error when starting HBase 2.5.11 in Ubuntu Studio 20.04
question.body:
I am trying to install Hbase in Ubuntu Studio and run it in standalone mode. I've installed Java, set up the JAVA_HOME and HBASE_HOME in .bashrc, set up the JAVA_HOME in hbase-env, set up the datadir and zookeeperDir in hbase-site, but when I try to run start-hbase.sh (and I've made sure to run it with the terminal at the bin folder), it doesn't work

<property>
    <name>hbase.cluster.distributed</name>
    <value>false</value>
  </property>
  <property>
    <name>hbase.tmp.dir</name>
    <value>./tmp</value>
  </property>
  <property>
    <name>hbase.unsafe.stream.capability.enforce</name>
    <value>false</value>
  </property>

  <property>
    <name>hbase.rootdir</name>
    <value>file:/home/seth/hbase-2.5.11/hbase</value>
  </property>

  <property>
    <name>hbase.zookeeper.property.dataDir</name>
    <value>/home/seth/hbase-2.5.11/zookeeper</value>
  <property>
This is my hbase-site configuration

Whenever I try to start Hbase, this is the error I get

seth@seth-VirtualBox:~/hbase-2.5.11/bin$ start-hbase.sh
running master, logging to /home/seth/hbase-2.5.11//logs/hbase-seth-master-seth-VirtualBox.out
/home/seth/hbase-2.5.11/bin/hbase-daemon.sh: line 92: kill: (3301) - No such process

bject
: running regionserver, logging to /home/seth/hbase-2.5.11//logs/hbase-seth-regionserver-seth-VirtualBox.out
: /home/seth/hbase-2.5.11/bin/hbase-daemon.sh: line 92: kill: (3419) - No such process
: 
: bject

I've followed several tutorials at this point, and I'm not sure what I'm doing wrong. Is there anything else I should be doing?
